newsitem.title: USA: Merl exercises option for Universal stake.
newsitem.headline: Merl exercises option for Universal stake.

text.p: Merl Industries of Tennessee Inc said it exercised its option to buy 60.5 percent of the total capital stock of Universal Life Insurance Co.
The company said it exercised its option on December 27 to buy 105,263 authorized but not issued shares, relying on a $13.5 million commitment from Bankers Capital of Boston.
Universal Life is privately-held and based in Memphis, Tennessee.
But Merl said Universal management might refuse to deliver the shares to the escrow agent, and there could be no assurances Merl could acquire the shares.

If Universal's management chose not to deliver the shares, Merl said it would proceed with its tender offer, already filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, to acquire 100 percent of the outstanding 65,884 Universal shares. There could be no assurances this offer would be successful, the company said.
